Question_1.Context: The study focused on developing and validating a method for the quantitative analysis of bile acids in rat plasma.
Question_1.Question: What was the primary purpose of the study described in the text?
Question_1.A: To investigate the effect of Ivermectin on lipid metabolism
Question_1.B: To explore the effect of Ivermectin on plasma bile acid levels in rats
Question_1.C: To study the enterohepatic circulation of bile acids
Question_1.D: To analyze the impact of bile acids on liver function
Question_1.Source: To explore the effect of IVM on plasma BA levels in rat, an ultra-high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (UHPLC–MS/MS) method was developed and validated for simultaneous determination of seven major BAs in rat plasma.

Question_2.Context: The study involved administering Ivermectin to rats and analyzing the changes in plasma bile acid levels.
Question_2.Question: What method was developed and validated for the simultaneous determination of seven major bile acids in rat plasma?
Question_2.A: Ultra-high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (UHPLC–MS/MS)
Question_2.Source: an ultra-high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (UHPLC–MS/MS) method was developed and validated for simultaneous determination of seven major BAs in rat plasma.

Question_3.Context: The study explored the effect of Ivermectin on plasma bile acid levels in rats.
Question_3.Question: Which receptor is primarily involved in the homeostasis and enterohepatic circulation of bile acids?
Question_3.Source: Farnesoid X receptor (FXR) is the crucial nuclear receptor expressed mainly in the liver and intestine which involves in the homeostasis and enterohepatic circulation of BAs.

Question_4.Context: The study revealed significant changes in specific bile acid levels after administering Ivermectin to rats.
Question_4.Question: Which bile acid levels were significantly reduced after 14 days of Ivermectin administration?
Question_4.Source: Once-daily administration of IVM for 14 days resulted in significant reduction in cholic acid and deoxycholic acid levels.

Question_5.Context: The study highlighted the impact of Ivermectin on specific bile acid profiles in rats.
Question_5.Question: Which bile acid levels were significantly increased after 14 days of Ivermectin administration?
Question_5.Source: Interestingly, tauro-α-muricholic acid and tauro-β-muricholic acid levels were significantly increased.

Question_6.Context: The study provided insights into the effects of Ivermectin on bile acid homeostasis in rats.
Question_6.Question: Which nuclear receptor is considered a promising target in the management of various liver and metabolic diseases?
Question_6.Source: FXR also involves in the homeostasis of lipid and glucose and has become a promising target in the management of hyperlipidemia, diabetes, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, cholestasis, primary biliary cholangitis and chronic inflammatory diseases of the liver and intestine.

Question_7.Context: The study discussed the importance of bile acids in metabolic diseases and the impact of Ivermectin on bile acid profiles.
Question_7.Question: Which bile acid is synthesized from cholesterol and conjugated to glycine or taurine to form bile salts?
Question_7.Source: Bile acids (BAs) are synthesized from cholesterol and then conjugated to glycine or taurine to form bile salts.

Question_8.Context: The study emphasized the role of bile acids in regulating lipid and glucose metabolism.
Question_8.Question: Which bile acid is considered a secondary bile acid produced in the intestine by gut microbiota?
Question_8.Source: Some BAs are converted to secondary BAs in the intestine by gut microbiota.

Question_9.Context: The study highlighted the importance of bile acids in various diseases and the impact of Ivermectin on bile acid levels.
Question_9.Question: Which bile acid is reabsorbed into the systemic circulation from the terminal ileum?
Question_9.Source: Most of the BAs are reabsorbed into the systemic circulation from the terminal ileum.

Question_10.Context: The study provided insights into the effects of Ivermectin on bile acid profiles in rats.
Question_10.Question: Which bile acid levels were not significantly affected after 14 days of Ivermectin administration?
Question_10.Source: While glycodeoxycholic acid and taurodeoxycholic acid levels were not affected.
